definition: lit. the weak are prey to the strong (idiom); fig. predatory behavior/the law of the jungle
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Both documents challenge the notion of a dog-eat-dog society, where survival of the fittest reigns.
sentences.chinese: 两份文书都对适者生存的弱肉强食社会观念提出挑战。

sentences.english: Sam's interest tends towards the reputedly 'ugly' and predatory side of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 山姆钟情于海洋所谓“丑陋”和弱肉强食的一面。

definition: see 成則為王，敗則為寇|成则为王，败则为寇[cheng2 ze2 wei2 wang2 , bai4 ze2 wei2 kou4]
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to use one's strength to bully the weak (idiom)
see 恃強欺弱|恃强欺弱[shi4 qiang2 qi1 ruo4]
survival/the struggle to eke out a living/to seek for continued existence

pinyin: she4 hui4 Da2 er3 wen2 zhu3 yi4

definition: the ways of the world/the morals of the time
lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2
